Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Curatela per Taylor & Francis di un volume collettaneo: The Routledge Companion to Mergers and Acquisiitons, coeditors: Annette Risberg and David R. King

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: VII workshop annuale di Aidea Giovani dal titolo “Rilevare, gestire ed organizzare nella New Economy. Cambiamenti nella visione sistemico processuale dell’amministrazione aziendale”, Università Bocconi di Milano, presentazione del seguente paper: Considerazioni in materia di corporate governance: un’analisi comparativa di imprese quotate e non quotate, coautore: Arturo Capasso.

Workshop Sinergie “Logistica integrata tra teoria e pratica: tendenze evolutive”, Lecce, presentazione del seguente paper: Supply chain management e outsourcing logistico nel settore sanitario: il caso e-sanità

Convegno: “Business excellence. Make it happen ! “, Verona, presentazione del seguente paper: Quality management in post-acquisition integration processes, coautori: Arturo Capasso ed Edoardo Imperiali.
Euram Annual Conference, Saint Andrews, presentazione del seguente paper: Learning from multiple acquisitions: towards a conceptualization of an integration capability, coautore: Arturo Capasso.
Euram Annual Conference, Munich, presentazione del seguente paper: Managing the post-acquisition integration process: does an integration capability exist?, coautore: Arturo Capasso.
Track organizer, Euram Conference, Oslo, Norvegia "Mergers and Acquisitions: Theories, methods, experiences"
Euram Conference, Oslo, presentazione del seguente paper: Research methods in M&A studies.

Il distretto industriale di San Marco dei Cavoti fra crisi e potenzialità di rilancio: presentazione dei primi risultati della ricerca empirica– Iniziativa nell’ambito del progetto Equal “CABRIC”, Benevento, Università degli Studi del Sannio.
Track organizer, Euram Annual Conference, Lubiana, Slovenia "Mergers and acquisitions: theories, methods and experiences"
Euram Conference, Lubiana, presentazione del seguente paper: On the operationalization of the M&A performance construct.
Euram Conference, Liverpool, presentazione del seguente paper: The M&A performance construct- a critical analysis, coautore: Annette Risberg.
Euram Annual Conference, Liverpool, track organizer: Toward an engaged community of M&A scholars.
Euram Annual Conference, Rome. Track organizer: "Toward an enaged community of M&A scholars"
Strategic Management Society Conference Extension, Napoli- poster session: The intergenerational transition in family business: a literature review, coautore: Ambra Altavilla.
Temporal issues in process research, Internal seminar, Department of Intercultural Communication and Management, Copenhagen Business School, Frederiksberg.

Entrepreneurial Ecosystems and the diffusion of start ups, First International Entrepreneurship Exemplars Conference, Catania, presentazione del seguente paper: The venture capitalist-entrepreneur relationship. Evidence from Italy, coautori: Matteo Rossi e Arturo Capasso
AIDEA Bicentennial Conference, presentazione del seguente paper: Corporate Venture Capital: current trends and future direction, Coautore: Matteo Rossi

Euromed Annual Meeting, Estoril, presentazione dei seguenti paper: Temporality in intergenerational transition: a process study of a small business, coautore: Carlo Mari The venture capitalist-entrepreneur relationship. Evidence from Italy, coautori: Matteo Rossi e Arturo Capasso

Euromed Annual Meeting, Estoril, presentazione dei seguenti lavori: "The venture capitalist-entrepreneur relationship. Evidence from Italy", coautori: Arturo Capasso e Matteo Rossi "Temporality in intergenerational transition: a process study of a small business", coautore: Carlo Mari

Improving acquisition performance with contextual ambidexterity: the role of integration leadership and mechanisms, Internal Seminar, Copenhagen Business School, Department of Intercultural Communication and Management, Frederiksberg.
EGOS Colloquium, Rotterdam, presentazione del seguente paper: "Strategic windows: achieving benefits of speed in acquisitions", coautori: David R. King, Annette Risberg
Syposium organizer and panellist speaker, Euram Annual Conference, Parigi. "Mergers and acquisitions: bridging substantive, methodological and conceptual conversations".
Euram Annual Conference, Parigi, presentazione del seguente paper: "Speed in acquisitios: advancing a process perspective", coautori: David R. King e Annette Risberg

Euromed Annual Meeting, Varsavia: presentazione dei seguenti paper: "Strategic renewal, acquisitions and ambidexterity" "Leadership and internationalization in cross-border mergers and acquisitions from the Arabia Gulf", coautore: Kathleen M. Park

Relazione su invito a M&A expert Meeting presso MCI- Innsbruck. Titolo della presentazione: Acquisition strategies from emerging economies acquirers Coautore: Dr. Kathleen M. Park- MIT (USA) and Gulf Institute of Technology (Q8)

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Borsa di studio post- laurea dal titolo: "Il settore delle costruzioni in Italia con particolare riferimento alla Campania” - Borsa di Studio ACEN, erogata dalla Fondazione Politecnica per il Mezzogiorno d’Italia. Coordinatore: Prof. Sergio Sciarelli
C.E.S.U.N.(Centro interdipartimentale studi per l’edilizia) dell'Università Federico II di Napoli. Responsabile della ricerca dal titolo: "La certificazione di biocompatibilità dei prodotti edilizi.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: L'articolo "The (Mis)measurement of M&A performance" pubblicato su Scandinavian Journal of Management nel dicembre del 2011 ha ricevuto un articolo di commento da parte di un autorevole studioso europeo di fusioni e acquisizioni. Very, P. (2011), Acquisition performance and “the quest for the holy grail”, Scandinavian Journal of Management, 27(4), 434-437, ISSN 0956- 5221

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: The M&A performance construct: a critical analysis--Principal Investigator: Olimpia Meglio; Co-investigator: Prof. Annette Risberg, Copenhagen Business School. Research Output: The (Mis)measurement of M&A performance: a systematic narrative literature review, Scandinavian Journal of Management, 2011, december issue.

Methodological challenges in the study of mergers and acquisitions. Principal Investigator: Olimpia Meglio; Co-investigator: Prof. Annette Risberg, Copenhagen Business School. Research output: Megers and Acquisitions--Time for a methodological rejuvenation of the field? Scandinavian Journal of Management, 2010, march issue.

Mergers and acquisitions failure rates. Principal Investigator: Prof. Annette Risberg, Copenhagen Business School; Co-investigator: Olimpia Meglio. Research output: Book chapter in an edited book, pusblished by Edward Elgar in 2012.

Acquisition typologies: analyzing how M&A scholars treat mergers and acquisitions in empirical studies. Principal Investigator: Olimpia Meglio; Co-investigator: Prof. Annette Risberg, Copenhagen Business School. Research output: a book chapter published in an annual volume, Advances in Mergers and Acquisitions, 2012 issue.

Contextual ambidexterity in M&As. Principal Investigator: Olimpia Meglio. Co-investigators: Prof. David R. King (Iowa State) and Prof. Annette Risberg (CBS). Research output: Improving acquisition outcomes with contextual ambidexterity, Human Resource Management, 2015, december issue.

Speed in acquisitions: a process perspective. Principal Investigator: Olimpia Meglio. Co-investigators: Prof. David R. King (Iowa State University) and Prof. Annette Risberg (CBS). Research output: Speed in acquisitions: a managerial framework, accepted for publication for Business Horizon in july 2016, expected publication issue: june 2017.

Dynamic growth of new ventures: the role of Venture Capital Capabiities. Principal Investigator: Olimpia Meglio. Co-investigators: Prof. Arturo Capasso (Università degli Studi del Sannio & Luiss) e Prof. Arabella Mocciaro Li Destri (Università degli Studi di Palermo). Research output: Fostering dynamic growth in new ventures through venture capital: conceptualizing venture capital capabilities, accepted for publication and published online first in Long Range Planning.

Internationalization and Innovation in emerging economies acquirers: the case of an Arab Gulf logistic company. Principal Investigator: Dr. Kathleen M. Park, MIT (USA) and GUST (Q8). Current status: article submitted to R&D Management, R&R decision after first round.

Post-acquisition strategies from emerging economies acquirers. Principal Investigator: Kathleen M. Park (MIT & GUST); Co-investigators: Olimpia Meglio, Prof. Florian Bauer (Innsbruck University) and Prof. Shlomo Tarba (University of Birmingham). Expected output: article submission to Journal of Business Research.

Strategic renewal and M&As: the contribution of ambidexterity. Principal Investigator: Olimpia Meglio. Co-investigator: Dr. Kathleen M. Park (MIT & GUST). Expected output: book chapter for an edited book published by Gower. Editors: Dr. Aybars Tuncdogan, Cardiff University, UK; Prof.Adam Lindgreen, Cardiff University, UK, Prof. Frans Van Den Bosch, Erasmus University Rotterdam, Netherlands; Prof. Henk Volberda, Erasmus University Rotterdam, Netherlands

Do M&As benefit corporate social responsibility? Evidence from an Arab Gulf company. Principal Investigator: Olimpia Meglio. Co-investigator: Dr. Kathleen M. Park (MIT& GUST) and Prof. Svante Schriber, Stockholm School of Business. Expected output: journal article.

What performance? Toward new perspectives on acquisition success and failure. Principal Investigator: Prof. Svante Schriber, Stockholm Business School. Co-investigator: Olimpia Meglio. Expected output: journal article.
